articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Frankfurt-listed shares of Nvidia jumped 8.7% on Thursday, lifting tech shares around the world, after the company forecast quarterly revenue that smashed expectations and announced a $25 billion buyback.
articles.title: Nvidia's Frankfurt shares surge as stellar results seen keeping AI rally alive

articles.author: Yu Xie, Yoruk Bahceli
articles.description: Global investors fleeing China have one simple message for the country's leadership: put prudence aside for a short while, and start spending big.
articles.title: Analysis: Stimulus or bust: Investors staying out of China until the spending starts

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: The new Caesars casino in Danville, Virginia, is a temporary facility reminiscent of an airplane hangar and with limited food and drink options.
articles.title: Fed coming up snake eyes in its battle with spend-happy consumers

articles.author: Ana Mano
articles.description: Brazil is set to overtake the U.S. this year as the world's top corn exporter, reflecting both a bumper harvest and logistical breakthroughs such as the consolidation of northern export routes, which are boosting the competitiveness of the South American grains powerhouse.
articles.title: Analysis: Brazil clears bottlenecks to oust US as top corn exporter

articles.author: Valerie Insinna, David Shepardson
articles.description: Boeing (BA.N) has recently identified a new 737 MAX quality problem involving supplier Spirit AeroSystems (SPR.N) that has resulted in improperly drilled holes on the aft pressure bulkhead, the planemaker said on Wednesday.
articles.title: New Boeing 737 MAX supplier defect to delay aircraft deliveries

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Dollar Tree (DLTR.O) forecast annual profit largely below estimates on Thursday as it expects a hit from a shift in spending towards lower-margin consumables, with Americans under pressure from still-high inflation.
articles.title: Dollar Tree forecasts tepid annual profit as US spending slowdown bites

articles.author: Danilo Masoni
articles.description: It's hard to be bullish about real estate in an environment of sharply higher interest rates. Yet unloved property stocks in Europe staged a surprise rally this summer, suggesting contrarian investors are starting to look past the worst.
articles.title: Bounce in European property stocks: false start or turning point?

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Crash investigators on Thursday picked through the wreckage of a jet said to have been carrying Russian mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin that crashed with no survivors, two months after he led a mutiny against the army leadership.
articles.title: Yevgeny Prigozhin: Investigators trawl site of plane crash believed to have killed Wagner boss

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump is due to report to an Atlanta jail on Thursday to face charges stemming from his effort to overturn his 2020 election loss, in the fourth criminal case to hit the former president this year.
articles.title: Trump to report to Atlanta jail to face charges in election-subversion case

articles.author: Julie Zhu, Fanny Potkin, Eduardo Baptista, Michael Martina
articles.description: For a decade until 2018, China sought to recruit elite foreign-trained scientists under a lavishly funded program that Washington viewed as a threat to U.S. interests and technological supremacy.
articles.title: China quietly recruits overseas chip talent as US tightens curbs
